page.title: 04Other Changes
page.content: One of Wolvey's older residents showed us a photograph of Wolvey's last windmill being pulled down. "Of course," he said,"there used to be plenty of{WINDMILLS}in Wolvey at one time but there's not one standing now.Just the name of Mill Lane remains." Twelves years ago the{LANDSCAPE}was changed when a row of elm trees was cut down stretching from the new school down to the River Anker in Bulkington Road.They all had{DUTCH ELM {DISEASE.} When the{M69 MOTORWAY}opened between Ansty and Hinckley about 9 years ago it made a great change in the village. What had been the busy A46 trunk road had now been relieved of its heavy lorries and traffic going between Coventry and Leicester.
